instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.TPS62180: What is TPS62180? This is a power chip responsible for many different power rails on 2016-2020 Macbook Pros,  most often known as the SSD buck converter chip responsible for NAND power rails.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Couple of corded capacitors right next to <CHIP>U9850</CHIP>.  I want to replace <CHIP>U9850</CHIP> as well to be on the safe side but when i go to digikey there are two different <CHIP>TPS62180</CHIP>.  can someone help me choose the correct one?  thanks!

[ATTACH type="full"]61279[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: both are working?  just curious whats the difference?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: I didn't see real difference in the datasheet...
